posts.name: baolong.xiong
posts.cooked:
I am a new to FDB, I want to backup to s3 through backup agent pod and run command:

FDB_TLS_CA_FILE=/etc/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.trust.crt fdbbackup start --knob_http_request_aws_v4_header=true -C /mnt/config-volume/cluster-file -d 'blobstore://key:secret@oss-cn-hangzhou-internal.aliyuncs.com:443/hzbyconityfdbtest/backup/test0924?bucket=backuptest&secure_connection=1'  --log

`it returns The backup on tag `default' was successfully submitted.but it acturaly not works,
```

posts.name: baolong.xiong
posts.cooked:
fdbbackup status -C /mnt/config-volume/cluster-file
The previous backup on tag `default’ at blobstore://key:secret@func-saas-private.oss-cn-hangzhou-internal.aliyuncs.com:443/backup/test0924?bucket=func-saas-private&secure_connection=1 has been aborted.
BackupUID: 79423dd12a0b29369e388860b1602326
BackupURL: blobstore://key:secret@func-saas-private.oss-cn-hangzhou-internal.aliyuncs.com:443/hzbyconityfdbtest/backup/test0924?bucket=func-saas-private&secure_connection=1
Recent Errors (since initialization)
20.57 minute(s) ago : ‘Network connection failed’ on ‘file_backup_write_logs_5.2’

The logs do not show any errors, only that the --tls-key-file configuration was not set because I did not find this file in the backup agent’s Pod

I would be extremely grateful if anyone familiar with this area could provide an answer to this question.

posts.name: Johannes Scheuermann
posts.cooked:
Just to make sure, the environment variable FDB_TLS_CA_FILE is also set on the backup_agent pods? How did you start the backup agent pods?

edit: The logs above are from the pod where you ran the fdbbackup start command? Or from one of the backup_agent pods?

posts.name: baolong.xiong
posts.cooked:
yes logs from one of backup_agent pod where i run fdbbackup command and the pod create by deployment file

---- Replied Message ----

    Cc | |
    Subject | [FoundationDB] [Using FoundationDB] Backup to s3(ali cloud oss) through backup agent pod error Net2TLSInitError |

| johscheuer Johannes Scheuermann
September 25 |

  • | - |

Just to make sure, the environment variable FDB_TLS_CA_FILE is also set on the backup_agent pods? How did you start the backup agent pods?

edit: The logs above are from the pod where you ran the fdbbackup start command? Or from one of the backup_agent pods?
